extendedIngredients.name: raw shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 3 pounds unpeeled, large raw shrimp (21/25 count)

extendedIngredients.name: worcestershire sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup LEA & PERRINS Original Worcestershire Sauce

title: Perfect Beach Shrimp
summary: Perfect Beach Shrimp is a gluten free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian main course. One portion of this dish contains about 47g of protein, 34g of fat, and a total of 568 calories. This recipe serves 6. For $5.19 per serving, this recipe covers 26% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. Head to the store and pick up old bay seasoning, ketchup, shrimp, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 35 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 50%, this dish is solid. Try Beach Shrimp, Perfect Poached Shrimp, and LuLu's Perfect Peel-and-Eat Shrimp for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Rabble Pinot Gris with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400. Stir together first 5 ingredients. Place shrimp in a broiler pan; pour butter mixture over shrimp.                                                                                                 Bake at 400 for 25 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink, stirring every 10 minutes. Garnish, if desired.

steps.step: Place shrimp in a broiler pan; pour butter mixture over shrimp.
Bake at 400 for 25 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink, stirring every 10 minutes.
